headline: Coca-Cola CEO Shift Pairs BodyArmor Hit With New Restructuring Plans
summary: Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) reported Q4 earnings that included a leadership transition as James Quincey prepares to retire as CEO. Henrique Braun is set to become CEO at the end of March, taking over with new plans for product development and restructuring. The quarter included an impairment charge of nearly US$1b related to the BodyArmor sports drink brand, which weighed on reported operating income in North America. Management outlined restructuring actions that involve corporate layoffs alongside...

headline: New Coca-Cola CEO eyes improved innovation
summary: “Our innovation today is not where it needs to be,” Henrique Braun, who is set to move to from the role of Coca-Cola’s COO, said.

headline: Alphabet’s Rare 100-Year Bond Tells Us That Money Is Easy
summary: Lending money to Alphabet for a century might seem to raise some serious questions.  Will we still use Google to search the internet in the 22nd century?  The risks investors should be focused on are more mundane, but also closer to hand: The prospects for artificial intelligence, the increasing debt load of Big Tech and the risks that come with joining a crowd throwing money at a fashionable industry.

headline: AI Anxiety Rattles Wall Street's Old Guard
summary: While the Dow Jones managed to notch another record high, the broader market felt the chill of "AI creep" as investors began dumping financial stocks over fears of automation. Coupled with a massive $8.2 billion loss at Ford and lukewarm retail data, the day served as a stark reminder that the AI revolution is now coming for the service sector's bottom line.

raw.headline: AI Anxiety Rattles Wall Street's Old Guard

headline: KO Q4 Deep Dive: Revenue Miss, Stable Volume, and Leadership Transition Shape Outlook
summary: Beverage company Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 as sales rose 3.6% year on year to $11.82 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.58 per share was 2.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: CocaCola Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: CocaCola (NYSE:KO) executives used the company’s fourth-quarter 2025 earnings call to recap full-year performance, outline 2026 guidance, and discuss a leadership transition that will move Chief Executive Officer James Quincey into an executive chairman role while Henrique Braun becomes CEO. Leader
